content.description: Stand start and traverse the smoothnesss.
content.location: This is the smooth lip arete that trends right.

content.description: Stand start on the left arete about 5-6 feet left of the problem Fork in the Road. Move right and up.
content.location: This is on the backside of the Phantom Boulder.

content.description:
This roof is one of the classics here, a must do for sure. 

  Sit start the smooth low arete and find your way through the roof to top out. Amazing!
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter. The kneebar landing area is a bit hairy.
content.location: It is on the west side of the boulder underneath the roof.

content.description: Sit start on the left and move up the crack and face. It is easier if you use the big block for feet.
content.location: This is on the backside of the Phantom Boulder. Look for the really nice patina face.

content.description:
Squat start on a good crimp under the overhang and a good foot far left. Move out to get right hand on a small but good crimp on the face, and then slap your left hand up the inside of the arete on some slopey holds, get your feet up, throw your right hand up to a good three finger crimp, and top out on good holds. 

  (I think this is new (?) and maybe V4, maybe harder... if you are short....)
content.location: This route is in between Phantom Roof and Fork In The Road starting on a good, horizontal crimp under the overhang, following the corner/face, and finishing on good holds.

content.description: This is a large block with a few problems. This block is readily distinguishable by its flat top.
